purpose: To provide a flexible and extensible framework for building AI-powered applications in Ruby.
principle: Utilizes a domain-specific language (DSL) in Ruby to define and manage AI tasks, actions, and agents, allowing for seamless integration with various AI models.
reusability: Offers base classes and a DSL for easy extension and integration into Ruby applications, supporting a wide range of AI models.
limitations: Primarily focused on Ruby, which may limit adoption in non-Ruby projects; the framework is in alpha stage, indicating potential instability and incomplete features.
name: sublayer
description: A model-agnostic Ruby Generative AI DSL and framework. Provides base classes for building Generators, Actions, Tasks, and Agents that can be used to build AI powered applications in Ruby.
highlight: Model-agnostic framework for building AI-powered applications in Ruby with a focus on Generators, Actions, Tasks, and Agents.
